name: Coreflex - Typical Butt End Assembly Checklist. Grids:
Substrate is acceptable and as per specification
Cetseal bead to stick Coreflex 60 with APC core facing installer
Site management has been advised to ensure all contractors working nearby are aware of slip hazard
Site management has been advised not to lay/sit/locate anything material or tool wise on membrane AT ALL
Site management has been informed that no hot-works/grinding to take place near any membrane
Site management has been informed not to compromise water control in anyway
Have an awareness of direction of application
Ensure any laps are clear from pooled water
Ensure foot/machinery traffic doesn't compromise any laps
Ensure water control is in place and maintained 24/7 with an appointed person
No hot-works/grinding to be carried out in close proximity to membrane without supervision to ensure membrane damage isn’t incurred
Water control in place 24/7 with an appointed person
Substrate is smooth (no sharp edge aggregate)
Substrate is free of debris, pooled water or ice
Weather is going to be suitable for install
No stones larger than 19mm in substrate
Standing ice, water, snow and debris removed
Ensure substrate doesn’t deteriorate compromising existing membrane
Debris is not to blow onto existing membrane (check surrounding environment)
Test weld made to calibrate welding equipment in AM
Test weld made to calibrate welding equipment in PM
Coreflex - Wall floor junction / detail Checklist. Grids:
Substrate is acceptable and as per specification
Voltex DPC must be removed 100mm minimum for lapping
Coreflex60 min 300mm lapped onto the floor
Coreflex to floor lap welded minimum of 100mm
Substrate is acceptable and as per specification
Voltex DPC must be removed 100mm minimum for lapping
Coreflex60 min 300mm lapped onto the floor
Coreflex to floor lap welded minimum of 100mm
Coreflex Pre-Installation Checklist (PERFORMED AT START OF JOB)
Concrete substrate must be uniform smooth finish with 19mm max sized aggregate to be used
No sharp edge aggregate to protrude through the smooth substrate layer.
Substrate must be free of debris (windy conditions need to be accounted for)
No standing water to be present where application is to take place
Weather forecase must be monitored to ensure substrate doesn't become compromised
Coreflex - Pile Cap Terminations Checklist. Grids:
Substrate is acceptable and as per specification
Pile cap termination requires 1 coat of sika 42 at 10ml atop pile then Akwaswell
Place Coreflexx 60 100mm on to pile top termination bar
Tooled Cetseal bead to edge of Coreflex
Watersop XP to sit between Cetseal bead and reo of the pile
Voltex SWR as the protection layer
